Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; PAINTED
Name: Cantharos
Description: This cantharos in terracotta constitutes a beautiful example of a new type of receptacle created by the egyptian potters, under Greek influence. It presents a vase with the feet painted in black with a very smooth surface. The higher part of the belly, decorated with garlands, has two handles with thumb-indexes. The piece which comes from the excavations of El-Miniya oual Chourafa probably dates from the 3rd century BC.
